intro: Protium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered protium, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
